He explains quite clearly and with saddness that he will not be able to finish the book before the season and hopes to be able to do it for 2017. He also goes on to explain to the readers of the books, whilst warning of spoilers,  in what ways the future of the books will diverge from the series, so that no avid reader will not misinterpreat his stor line. The relativity of this question has always been of concern. Will a novel be "released" before it's TV-inspired shows decides to "begin" the season based up it?  If this question had been less relative (will the novel be published; will the novel be released in eBook form; will the season for the TV show begin be at the same date as the last 5 season, or close to it, not at the end of April and almost May?)  So, in fact, this is already a loser's question. It hasn't been Fermi-ized, so to speak. And thus may rank as one of the least predictable in this series. Despite the protestations of a fellow 'Cat #Go'CatsGo "Here it is, the first of January. The book is not done, not delivered. No words can change that. I tried, I promise you. I failed. I blew the Halloween deadline, and I've now blown the end of the year deadline. And that almost certainly means that no, THE WINDS OF WINTER will not be published before the sixth season of  Look, I have always had problems with deadlines. For whatever reason, I don't respond well to them. Back in November, when I returned to Northwestern to accept my Alumni Award, I told the Medill students that was why I started writing fiction instead of getting a job on a newspaper. I knew even then that daily deadlines would kill me. That was a joke, of course... but there was truth in it too. I wrote my first novel, DYING OF THE LIGHT, without a contract and without a deadline. No one even knew I was writing a novel until I sent the completed book to Kirby to sell. I wrote FEVRE DREAM the same way. I wrote THE ARMAGEDDON RAG the same way. No contracts, no deadlines, no one waiting. Write at my own pace and deliver when I'm done. That's really how I am most comfortable, even now."

This seems very unlikely (<1% chance). A few quotes from George R R Martin's most recent comment on 2nd Jan 2016 (which can be found at http://grrm.livejournal.com/465247.html ) "There's also a lot still left to write. I am months away still... and that's if the writing goes well." and more tellingly - "We all wanted book six ... to come out before season six aired. Assuming the show would return in early April, that meant THE WINDS OF WINTER had to be published before the end of March, at the latest. For that to happen, my publishers told me, they would need the completed manuscript before the end of October." and, most damning of all - "And that almost certainly means that no, THE WINDS OF WINTER will not be published before the sixth season of GAME OF THRONES premieres in April (mid April, we are now told, not early April, but those two weeks will not save me)." Clearly, the book was not finished by the end of October, nor by the end of December, and probably will not be finished in the first couple of months of 2016. Which pushes the likely publication date to June 2016 at the earliest, at least two months after season 6 airs.

Net I suspect we'll see the book in summer 2016 a few months after the start of TV series, and the TV series will have a very nearly complete manuscript to make that work, but a printout of a manuscript is a 3-4 months away from a final book on a typical publication schedule.

Updating for passage of time with no news (it's been 1 month).  I agonized over whether and how much to lower my prior estimate of 33% a kind of embarrassing amount given the nature of this qn :) .    I'm hesitant to move too low given I don't really have any new information or a good sense of what the timeline should look like over the next 5 months.  That said, if he were going to be ready to release by May, then he already knows it, so does the publisher, and it would be surprising that that hasn't leaked yet. Many people have done interesting analysis (@jsheth, @grysu, others I think) of lead time for each book based on pg counts.  Do any long time fans have info on how early the leaks were for prior books?  Ideally 3 dates: a) first leak; b) announcement of release date; c) release date. Here we are forecasting c, presumably the qn will close upon b, and a may or may not exist.  I don't really have a great sense for the "base rate" of a and b, and I haven't seen if it has been laid out by others, but it strikes me as probably the most relevant knowable info here. For the last book it was:  a) ??; b) Mar 3 2011; c) July 12 2011 (http://www.avclub.com/article/george-rr-martin-confirms-july-2011-release-date-f-52685).   Again, I don't have older books, or any evidence of a leak prior to Mar 3 from that book, but I guess it leads me to believe if he's done, he'll probably confirm a release date publicly well in advance (~4 months in that case).  In this case, we'd have to expect January at the latest for the public announcement date*.  I  would also be surprised if there weren't any leaks or a build up in crappy tabloid stories leading up to that.  It's pretty hotly anticipated, and by the point that he can announce a date, lots of people would have to be in the know...   That means really our timeline to the official announcement is probably something like ~6-7 weeks at most and we should probably start expecting leaks or "hints" late this month, or maybe in early January if its happening (again, if it leaks before the official announcement, I don't know if it will, I would just guess it might).  Instead, when he is doing live fan events or writing blog posts (which it seems like he is doing all the time) we are getting almost nothing.   So, given all that, I'm reducing my estimate to 15%, a bit below consensus and well below my prior level.  I'm hesitant to go too extreme because this could be announced and get resolved any day and I don't really "know" anything, it just seems like we are running out of time fast on the probable timeline here.

The last four books have averaged 1,128 pages.  As ASOIAF has gained more popularity, it has taken GRRM more days to write each page for each subsequent novel.  A Feast for Crows took 1.7 days / page and A Dance with Dragons took 1.8 days / page, compared to 0.8 for A Clash of Kings and 0.5 for A Storm of Swords.  Using 1.7 - 1.8 days per page implies a release date of 10/2016 - 2/2017.  I would assume it may take even longer since Winds of Winter is the penultimate book in the series and would think that GRRM may spend more time bringing the various plot lines to a conclusion.  In addition, demands on GRRM's schedule have increased as GoT has become more popular, probably leading to longer times for each subsequent book. The TV season has regularly come out at the beginning of April each year.  I think it could be delayed some this year, but I don't think HBO wants to risk a long delay since there is a risk that it turns off fans and then you get into summer.  GRRM has said that he has highlighted the major plot points and ending in case something happened to him.  In addition, the TV show has diverged from the book in a number of ways already, so I don't think the book is a bottleneck for the TV show.   The reports of stuff like the Spanish edition and Polish translations seem to be of limited hard value in predicting when Winds of Winter will be released.

And the delay in the season start could be seen as a way to buy more time.  Some googling also shows that GRRM has dialed down the amount of public appearances and such over the summer, but that could also be due to the normal cycle of PR coinciding the GoTs spring season. That being said, there is no mention of him being an alcoholic or smoker, no mention of prior illness, and he has the financial resources to overcome any possible illness.
- He has mentioned that his later books will be longer, up to 1500 pages, and therefore requiring a lengthier timeframe of completion (up to 5-6 years instead of 2)
- He may be busy with shorter novels and miscellaneous projectsa
- He already has the plot for Season 6 and does not need to finish the novel prior to it airing
- He has power over his publishers and financial reasons are not a driver On the flip side:
- He still is influenced by time pressure from his fans and to time his novel prior to the show
- It has been stated by various sources that the books is planned to be finished by 2016 My base rate is around 90% not going to be completed in 6 years with adjustments to account for the risk of his death and the need for more time to write given his fame.  95% confidence interval 0-12% or so, but leaning towards 0%.
